An absolutely wonderful puzzle game. I never expected to love this game to the extent that I do now. This is coming from someone who hates puzzles. 

Pros:
- Great scenery. Valve really pushed the Source engine to its limits to produce a believable and immersive experience. 
- Challenging, but not too hard. There were a few times I got stuck and had to really analyze the puzzle before I knew what to do. Mechanics are taught very well, and there will be little to no hand holding near the end of the game.
- Amazing writing. Every character in this game is written extremely well. Not once did I get tired of the story or characters.
- Entertaining gameplay. With the Portal Gun and many new additions, the game will not get old any time soon.
- Outstanding soundtrack. Every song in this game has a purpose that they serve well, especially during the escape sequences. 
- Workshop support. To make up for the short campaign, Valve introduced user-created levels that can be downloaded from the Workshop. Levels can be made in one of the menus.

Cons:
- Fairly Short. It took me around 5 and a half hours to beat this game, even with my many points of confusion.
